transcript.title: Ms Frances Adamson appointed Secretary of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
transcript.content:
I am pleased to announce the appointment of Ms Frances Adamson as the Secretary of the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade.

Ms Adamson is currently International Adviser in my office. From 2011 to 2015 Ms Adamson was Australia’s Ambassador to the People’s Republic of China.  She has also served in the Australian Consulate-General in Hong Kong, as Representative to the Australian Commerce and Industry Office in Taipei and in the Australian High Commission in London.  She was Chief of Staff to the Minister for Foreign Affairs and then the Minister for Defence from 2009 to 2010.

She has had a distinguished career as a diplomat and brings a depth of experience and understanding of international affairs to this position. I congratulate Ms Adamson on her appointment.

Ms Adamson’s appointment is for 5 years commencing on 22 July 2016.
